$!You must tell DVLA if you have hypoglycaemia $!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence##

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form DIAB1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.


$D
[Download ‘DIAB1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 298KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066647.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

You can find help and guidance on filling in the DIAB1 questionnaire in 'A guide to filling in your DIAB1 medical form'. 

$D
[Download ‘A guide to filling in your DIAB1 medical form’ (PDF, 414KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_202154.pdf "Download form instructions"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence##

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form DIAB1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form. If you want to apply for a C1 or C1E entitlement download the 'INS186' leaflet.

$D
[Download ‘DIAB1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 315KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_078900.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

$D
[Download ‘A guide for drivers with insulin treated diseases who wish to apply for C1 or C1E entitlement’ (INS186) (PDF, 230KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_179198.pdf "Download C1/C1E application guide"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
